cards.name: Visara the Dreadful
cards.text:
Flying
{T}: Destroy target creature. It can't be regenerated.
cards.flavor: "My eyes are my strongest feature."
cards.originalText:
Flying
{T}: Destroy target creature. It can't be regenerated.

cards.name: Walking Desecration
cards.text: {B}, {T}: Creatures of the creature type of your choice attack this turn if able.
cards.flavor: Such sacrilege turns blinding grief into blinding rage.
cards.originalText: {B}, {T}: Creatures of the type of your choice attack this turn if able.

cards.name: Withering Hex
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Whenever a player cycles a card, put a plague counter on Withering Hex.
Enchanted creature gets -1/-1 for each plague counter on Withering Hex.
cards.originalText:
Whenever a player cycles a card, put a plague counter on Withering Hex.
Enchanted creature gets -1/-1 for each plague counter on Withering Hex.

cards.name: Words of Waste
cards.text: {1}: The next time you would draw a card this turn, each opponent discards a card instead.
cards.flavor:
"Terror corrupts order and paralyzes instinct."
—Volume III, The Book of Decay

rulings.text: If multiple Words have been used prior to drawing a card, then you can choose which one to apply (and use up) each time you draw a card.

cards.originalText: {1}: The next time you would draw a card this turn, each opponent discards a card from his or her hand instead.

cards.name: Wretched Anurid
cards.text: Whenever another creature enters the battlefield, you lose 1 life.
cards.flavor: The only prince inside this frog is the one it ate.
cards.originalText: Whenever another creature comes into play, you lose 1 life.

cards.name: Aether Charge
cards.text: Whenever a Beast enters the battlefield under your control, you may have it deal 4 damage to target opponent or planeswalker.
cards.flavor: "Is it just me, or does that meteor have teeth?"
cards.originalText: Whenever a Beast comes into play under your control, you may have it deal 4 damage to target opponent.

cards.name: Aggravated Assault
cards.text: {3}{R}{R}: Untap all creatures you control. After this main phase, there is an additional combat phase followed by an additional main phase. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.

rulings.text: If you have enough mana, the ability may be activated more than once in a turn.
You will normally use this during your post-combat main phase so you can untap any creatures that attacked.

cards.originalText: {3}{R}{R}: Untap all creatures you control. After this phase, there is an additional combat phase followed by an additional main phase. Play this ability only any time you could play a sorcery.

cards.name: Airdrop Condor
cards.text:
Flying
{1}{R}, Sacrifice a Goblin creature: Airdrop Condor deals damage equal to the sacrificed creature's power to any target.
cards.flavor: It has two kinds of droppings, neither of which is particularly pleasant.
cards.originalText:
Flying
{1}{R}, Sacrifice a Goblin: Airdrop Condor deals damage equal to the sacrificed Goblin's power to target creature or player.

cards.name: Avarax
cards.text:
Haste
When Avarax enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a card named Avarax, reveal it, and put it into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.
{1}{R}: Avarax gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.originalText:
Haste
When Avarax comes into play, you may search your library for a card named Avarax, reveal it, and put it into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.
{1}{R}: Avarax gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Battering Craghorn
cards.text:
First strike
Morph {1}{R}{R} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
cards.flavor: Their skeletons can be found all over Skirk Ridge, tangled in each other's horns.
cards.originalText:
First strike
Morph {1}{R}{R} (You may play this face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)

cards.name: Blistering Firecat
cards.text:
Trample, haste
At the beginning of the end step, sacrifice Blistering Firecat.
Morph {R}{R} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
cards.originalText:
Trample, haste
At end of turn, sacrifice Blistering Firecat.
Morph {R}{R} (You may play this face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)

cards.name: Break Open
cards.text: Turn target face-down creature an opponent controls face up.
cards.flavor: There are two ways to resolve puzzling situations: thoughtful contemplation or force. After thoughtful contemplation, most barbarians choose force.

rulings.text: The player does not have to pay the Morph cost (if any) of the creature.

cards.originalText: Turn target face-down creature an opponent controls face up.

cards.name: Brightstone Ritual
cards.text: Add {R} for each Goblin on the battlefield.
cards.flavor: Wizards fought over the stone to exploit its power. Goblins fight over it because it's shiny.
cards.originalText: Add {R} to your mana pool for each Goblin in play.

cards.name: Butcher Orgg
cards.text: You may assign Butcher Orgg's combat damage divided as you choose among defending player and/or any number of creatures they control.
cards.flavor: It can kill you with three arms tied behind its back.

rulings.text: If it is blocked but then all of its blockers are removed before combat damage is assigned, then it won't be able to deal combat damage and you won't be able to use its ability.
You can use the ability to divide damage even if it is not blocked.

If you choose to use the ability to divide up the damage (and there is at least one point of damage to be assigned), you must choose at least one creature or the defending player, and can't choose more total creatures and players than the amount of damage being assigned (minimum 1 point per player or creature).

cards.originalText: You may divide Butcher Orgg's combat damage as you choose among defending player and/or any number of creatures he or she controls.

cards.name: Chain of Plasma
cards.text: Chain of Plasma deals 3 damage to any target. Then that player or that permanent's controller may discard a card. If the player does, they may copy this spell and may choose a new target for that copy.
cards.originalText: Chain of Plasma deals 3 damage to target creature or player. Then that player or that creature's controller may discard a card from his or her hand. If the player does, he or she may copy this spell and may choose a new target for that copy.

cards.name: Charging Slateback
cards.text:
Charging Slateback can't block.
Morph {4}{R} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
cards.flavor: Goblins prize its hide for building rock sled runners.
cards.originalText:
Charging Slateback can't block.
Morph {4}{R} (You may play this face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)

cards.name: Commando Raid
cards.text: Until end of turn, target creature you control gains "When this creature deals combat damage to a player, you may have it deal damage equal to its power to target creature that player controls."
cards.originalText: Until end of turn, target creature you control gains "When this creature deals combat damage to a player, you may have it deal damage equal to its power to target creature that player controls."

cards.name: Crown of Fury
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 and has first strike.
Sacrifice Crown of Fury: Enchanted creature and other creatures that share a creature type with it get +1/+0 and gain first strike until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "Passion, fire my heart."
cards.originalText:
Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 and has first strike.
Sacrifice Crown of Fury: Enchanted creature and other creatures that share a creature type with it get +1/+0 and gain first strike until end of turn.

cards.name: Custody Battle
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has "At the beginning of your upkeep, target opponent gains control of this creature unless you sacrifice a land."
cards.flavor: Goblins resolve disputes by splitting everything straight down the middle.
cards.originalText: Enchanted creature has "At the beginning of your upkeep, target opponent gains control of this creature unless you sacrifice a land."

cards.name: Dragon Roost
cards.text: {5}{R}{R}: Create a 5/5 red Dragon creature token with flying. (It can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
cards.flavor: A powerful mage created the roost to guard a portal between the planes. The mage is long gone, but dragons still keep watch at the gate.
cards.originalText: {5}{R}{R}: Put a 5/5 red Dragon creature token with flying into play.

cards.name: Dwarven Blastminer
cards.text:
{2}{R}, {T}: Destroy target nonbasic land.
Morph {R} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
cards.flavor: "Life is too short for something like a hunk of rock to get in my way."
cards.originalText:
{2}{R}, {T}: Destroy target nonbasic land.
Morph {R} (You may play this face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)

cards.name: Embermage Goblin
cards.text:
When Embermage Goblin enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a card named Embermage Goblin, reveal it, and put it into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.
{T}: Embermage Goblin deals 1 damage to any target.
cards.originalText:
When Embermage Goblin comes into play, you may search your library for a card named Embermage Goblin, reveal it, and put it into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.
{T}: Embermage Goblin deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Erratic Explosion
cards.text: Choose any target. Reveal cards from the top of your library until you reveal a nonland card. Erratic Explosion deals damage equal to that card's converted mana cost to that permanent or player. Put the revealed cards on the bottom of your library in any order.

rulings.text: If all your cards are lands, no damage is dealt.

cards.originalText: Choose target creature or player. Reveal cards from the top of your library until you reveal a nonland card. Erratic Explosion deals damage equal to that card's converted mana cost to that creature or player. Put the revealed cards on the bottom of your library in any order.

cards.name: Fever Charm
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Target creature gains haste until end of turn.
• Target creature gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
• Fever Charm deals 3 damage to target Wizard creature.
cards.originalText: Choose one Target creature gains haste until end of turn; or target creature gets +2/+0 until end of turn; or Fever Charm deals 3 damage to target Wizard.

cards.name: Flamestick Courier
cards.text:
You may choose not to untap Flamestick Courier during your untap step.
{2}{R}, {T}: Target Goblin creature gets +2/+2 and has haste for as long as Flamestick Courier remains tapped.

rulings.text: It checks the creature type when the ability is announced and resolved, but once the effect is placed on the creature, if its creature type changes the effect still continues.

cards.originalText:
You may choose not to untap Flamestick Courier during your untap step.
{2}{R}, {T}: As long as Flamestick Courier remains tapped, target Goblin gets +2/+2 and has haste.

cards.name: Goblin Machinist
cards.text: {2}{R}: Reveal cards from the top of your library until you reveal a nonland card. Goblin Machinist gets +X/+0 until end of turn, where X is that card's converted mana cost. Put the revealed cards on the bottom of your library in any order.

rulings.text: If all the cards in your library are lands, X is zero.

cards.originalText: {2}{R}: Reveal cards from the top of your library until you reveal a nonland card. Goblin Machinist gets +X/+0 until end of turn, where X is that card's converted mana cost. Put the revealed cards on the bottom of your library in any order.

cards.name: Goblin Piledriver
cards.text:
Protection from blue (This creature can't be blocked, targeted, dealt damage, or enchanted by anything blue.)
Whenever Goblin Piledriver attacks, it gets +2/+0 until end of turn for each other attacking Goblin.
cards.flavor: Throw enough goblins at any problem and it should go away. At the very least, there'll be fewer goblins.

rulings.text: The number of Goblins is counted when this ability resolves.

cards.originalText:
Protection from blue
Whenever Goblin Piledriver attacks, it gets +2/+0 until end of turn for each other attacking Goblin.

cards.name: Goblin Pyromancer
cards.text:
When Goblin Pyromancer enters the battlefield, Goblin creatures get +3/+0 until end of turn.
At the beginning of the end step, destroy all Goblins.
cards.flavor: "The good news is, we figured out how the wand works. The bad news is, we figured out how the wand works."

rulings.text: It only destroys goblins if it is on the battlefield at the end of turn.

cards.originalText:
When Goblin Pyromancer comes into play, all Goblins get +3/+0 until end of turn.
At end of turn, destroy all Goblins.

cards.name: Goblin Sharpshooter
cards.text:
Goblin Sharpshooter doesn't untap during your untap step.
Whenever a creature dies, untap Goblin Sharpshooter.
{T}: Goblin Sharpshooter deals 1 damage to any target.
cards.originalText:
Goblin Sharpshooter doesn't untap during your untap step.
Whenever a creature is put into a graveyard from play, untap Goblin Sharpshooter.
{T}: Goblin Sharpshooter deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Goblin Sky Raider
cards.text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
cards.flavor: The goblin word for "flying" is more accurately translated as "falling slowly."
cards.originalText: Flying

cards.name: Goblin Sledder
cards.text: Sacrifice a Goblin: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "Let's play 'sled.' Here's how it works: you're the sled."
cards.originalText: Sacrifice a Goblin: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Goblin Taskmaster
cards.text:
{1}{R}: Target Goblin creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
Morph {R} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
cards.flavor: For some reason, goblin fighting school isn't as crowded on day two.
cards.originalText:
{1}{R}: Target Goblin gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
Morph {R} (You may play this face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)

cards.name: Grand Melee
cards.text:
All creatures attack each combat if able.
All creatures block each combat if able.
cards.flavor: Hot blood washes away cold reason.
cards.originalText:
All creatures attack each turn if able.
All creatures block each turn if able.

cards.name: Gratuitous Violence
cards.text: If a creature you control would deal damage to a permanent or player, it deals double that damage to that permanent or player instead.
cards.flavor: Only the Cabal could make a fight to the death more deadly.
cards.originalText: If a creature you control would deal damage to a creature or player, it deals double that damage to that creature or player instead.

cards.name: Insurrection
cards.text: Untap all creatures and gain control of them until end of turn. They gain haste until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Maybe they wanted to be on the winning side for once."
—Matoc, lavamancer

rulings.text: You untap all creatures, control all creatures, and give all creatures Haste.

cards.originalText: Untap all creatures and gain control of them until end of turn. They gain haste until end of turn.

cards.name: Kaboom!
cards.text: Choose any number of target players. For each of those players, reveal cards from the top of your library until you reveal a nonland card. Kaboom! deals damage equal to that card's converted mana cost to that player, then you put the revealed cards on the bottom of your library in any order.

rulings.text: If all the cards in your library are lands, this card deals zero damage.
If you target more than one player, you do the whole process for each player in turn order.

cards.originalText: Choose any number of target players. For each of those players, reveal cards from the top of your library until you reveal a nonland card. Kaboom! deals damage equal to that card's converted mana cost to that player, then you put the revealed cards on the bottom of your library in any order.

cards.name: Lavamancer's Skill
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has "{T}: This creature deals 1 damage to target creature."
As long as enchanted creature is a Wizard, it has "{T}: This creature deals 2 damage to target creature."

rulings.text: If this card enchants a Wizard, the Wizard has both abilities and its controller can use either one.

cards.originalText:
Enchanted creature has "{T}: This creature deals 1 damage to target creature."
If enchanted creature is a Wizard, it has "{T}: This creature deals 2 damage to target creature."

cards.name: Lay Waste
cards.text:
Destroy target land.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
cards.flavor: Skirk Ridge had survived earthquakes, mudslides, and meteor showers. Then the goblins moved in.

rulings.text: Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

cards.originalText:
Destroy target land.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card from your hand: Draw a card.)

cards.name: Lightning Rift
cards.text: Whenever a player cycles a card, you may pay {1}. If you do, Lightning Rift deals 2 damage to any target.
cards.flavor: Options will cost you, but a lack of them will cost you even more.

rulings.text: You choose the target when this ability is put on the stack, but you do not decide whether or not to pay the mana until the ability resolves.

cards.originalText: Whenever a player cycles a card, you may pay {1}. If you do, Lightning Rift deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Mana Echoes
cards.text: Whenever a creature enters the battlefield, you may add an amount of {C} equal to the number of creatures you control that share a creature type with it.
cards.flavor: When the ground is saturated with mana, even the lightest footstep can bring it to the surface.

rulings.text: You either get zero mana or all the mana. You can't choose an amount in between.
You do get to count the creature itself, you even get one mana if it is the only creature you have on the battlefield (assuming it has at least one creature type).

cards.originalText: Whenever a creature comes into play, you may add {1} to your mana pool for each creature you control that shares a creature type with it.

cards.name: Menacing Ogre
cards.text:
Trample, haste
When Menacing Ogre enters the battlefield, each player secretly chooses a number. Then those numbers are revealed. Each player with the highest number loses that much life. If you are one of those players, put two +1/+1 counters on Menacing Ogre.

rulings.text: You have to choose zero or a positive number. It must be an integer number.

cards.originalText:
Trample, haste
When Menacing Ogre comes into play, each player secretly chooses a number. Then those numbers are revealed. Each player with the highest number loses that much life. If you are one of those players, put two +1/+1 counters on Menacing Ogre.

cards.name: Nosy Goblin
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice Nosy Goblin: Destroy target face-down creature.
cards.flavor: To his surprise, Furt discovered that the strange creatures were not at all like bugs.

rulings.text: If the target is turned face up before the ability resolves, the creature is no longer a legal target and is not destroyed.

cards.originalText: {T}, Sacrifice Nosy Goblin: Destroy target face-down creature.

cards.name: Pinpoint Avalanche
cards.text: Pinpoint Avalanche deals 4 damage to target creature. The damage can't be prevented.
cards.flavor:
"Some solve problems by thinking and talking. Others use rocks."
—Toggo, goblin weaponsmith
cards.originalText: Pinpoint Avalanche deals 4 damage to target creature. The damage can't be prevented.

cards.name: Reckless One
cards.text:
Haste
Reckless One's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Goblins on the battlefield.
cards.flavor: "Release chaos with me!"
cards.originalText:
Haste
Reckless One's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Goblins in play.

cards.name: Risky Move
cards.text:
At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player gains control of Risky Move.
When you gain control of Risky Move from another player, choose a creature you control and an opponent. Flip a coin. If you lose the flip, that opponent gains control of that creature.

rulings.text: The change of control of creatures does not end at end of turn or even when this card leaves the battlefield.
This card does not target any creatures or players.

cards.originalText:
At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player gains control of Risky Move.
When you gain control of Risky Move from another player, choose a creature you control and an opponent. Flip a coin. If you lose the flip, that opponent gains control of that creature.

cards.name: Rorix Bladewing
cards.text: Flying, haste
cards.flavor: In the smoldering ashes of Shiv, a few dragons strive to rebuild their native land. The rest seek any opportunity to restore the broken pride of their race.
cards.originalText: Flying, haste

cards.name: Searing Flesh
cards.text: Searing Flesh deals 7 damage to target opponent or planeswalker.
cards.flavor: Zemoo found out the hard way that "inflammable" and "flammable" mean the same thing.
cards.originalText: Searing Flesh deals 7 damage to target opponent.

cards.name: Shaleskin Bruiser
cards.text:
Trample
Whenever Shaleskin Bruiser attacks, it gets +3/+0 until end of turn for each other attacking Beast.
cards.flavor: Its only predators are the elements.
cards.originalText:
Trample
Whenever Shaleskin Bruiser attacks, it gets +3/+0 until end of turn for each other attacking Beast.

cards.name: Shock
cards.text: Shock deals 2 damage to any target.
cards.flavor:
"I love lightning It's my best invention since the rock."
—Toggo, goblin weaponsmith
cards.originalText: Shock deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Skirk Commando
cards.text:
Whenever Skirk Commando deals combat damage to a player, you may have it deal 2 damage to target creature that player controls.
Morph {2}{R} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
cards.originalText:
Whenever Skirk Commando deals combat damage to a player, you may have it deal 2 damage to target creature that player controls.
Morph {2}{R} (You may play this face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)

cards.name: Skirk Fire Marshal
cards.text:
Protection from red
Tap five untapped Goblins you control: Skirk Fire Marshal deals 10 damage to each creature and each player.
cards.flavor: He's boss because he's smart enough to get out of the way.

rulings.text: Since the ability does not have the {T} symbol, you can use the ability before this creature begins a turn under your control.
It can tap itself but is not required to do so.

cards.originalText:
Protection from red
Tap five untapped Goblins you control: Skirk Fire Marshal deals 10 damage to each creature and each player.

cards.name: Skirk Prospector
cards.text: Sacrifice a Goblin: Add {R}.
cards.flavor:
"I like goblins. They make funny little popping sounds when they die."
—Braids, dementia summoner
cards.originalText: Sacrifice a Goblin: Add {R} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Skittish Valesk
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, flip a coin. If you lose the flip, turn Skittish Valesk face down.
Morph {5}{R} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
cards.originalText:
At the beginning of your upkeep, flip a coin. If you lose the flip, turn Skittish Valesk face down.
Morph {5}{R} (You may play this face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)

cards.name: Slice and Dice
cards.text:
Slice and Dice deals 4 damage to each creature.
Cycling {2}{R} ({2}{R}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
When you cycle Slice and Dice, you may have it deal 1 damage to each creature.

rulings.text: Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

When you cycle this card, first the cycling ability goes on the stack, then the triggered ability goes on the stack on top of it. The triggered ability will resolve before you draw a card from the cycling ability.

The cycling ability and the triggered ability are separate. If the triggered ability doesn't resolve (due to being countered with Stifle, for example, or if all its targets have become illegal), the cycling ability will still resolve and you'll draw a card.

cards.originalText:
Slice and Dice deals 4 damage to each creature.
Cycling {2}{R} ({2}{R}, Discard this card from your hand: Draw a card.)
When you cycle Slice and Dice, you may have it deal 1 damage to each creature.

cards.name: Snapping Thragg
cards.text:
Whenever Snapping Thragg deals combat damage to a player, you may have it deal 3 damage to target creature that player controls.
Morph {4}{R}{R} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
cards.originalText:
Whenever Snapping Thragg deals combat damage to a player, you may have it deal 3 damage to target creature that player controls.
Morph {4}{R}{R} (You may play this face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)

cards.name: Solar Blast
cards.text:
Solar Blast deals 3 damage to any target.
Cycling {1}{R}{R} ({1}{R}{R}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
When you cycle Solar Blast, you may have it deal 1 damage to any target.

rulings.text: Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

When you cycle this card, first the cycling ability goes on the stack, then the triggered ability goes on the stack on top of it. The triggered ability will resolve before you draw a card from the cycling ability.

The cycling ability and the triggered ability are separate. If the triggered ability doesn't resolve (due to being countered with Stifle, for example, or if all its targets have become illegal), the cycling ability will still resolve and you'll draw a card.
You can cycle this card even if there are no targets for the triggered ability. That's because the cycling ability itself has no targets.

cards.originalText:
Solar Blast deals 3 damage to target creature or player.
Cycling {1}{R}{R} ({1}{R}{R}, Discard this card from your hand: Draw a card.)
When you cycle Solar Blast, you may have it deal 1 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Sparksmith
cards.text: {T}: Sparksmith deals X damage to target creature and X damage to you, where X is the number of Goblins on the battlefield.
cards.flavor: "If it didn't hurt, how would I know it worked?"
cards.originalText: {T}: Sparksmith deals X damage to target creature and X damage to you, where X is the number of Goblins in play.

cards.name: Spitfire Handler
cards.text:
Spitfire Handler can't block creatures with power greater than Spitfire Handler's power.

cards.flavor: "Wait 'til Toggo sees this!"
cards.originalText:
Spitfire Handler can't block creatures with power greater than Spitfire Handler's power.
{R}: Spitfire Handler gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Spurred Wolverine
cards.text: Tap two untapped Beasts you control: Target creature gains first strike until end of turn.
cards.flavor: After a few painful experiences, goblins learned not to pick their noses around the beasts.

rulings.text: Since the ability does not have the {T} symbol, you can use the ability before this creature begins a turn under your control.
It can tap itself but is not required to do so.

cards.originalText: Tap two untapped Beasts you control: Target creature gains first strike until end of turn.

cards.name: Starstorm
cards.text:
Starstorm deals X damage to each creature.
Cycling {3} ({3}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
cards.flavor: Pardic barbarians didn't complain when the Order started blaming every crisis on the Cabal.

rulings.text: Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

cards.originalText:
Starstorm deals X damage to each creature.

cards.name: Tephraderm
cards.text:
Whenever a creature deals damage to Tephraderm, Tephraderm deals that much damage to that creature.
Whenever a spell deals damage to Tephraderm, Tephraderm deals that much damage to that spell's controller.

rulings.text: The second ability triggers even if this card is dealt lethal damage.

cards.originalText:
Whenever a creature deals damage to Tephraderm, Tephraderm deals that much damage to that creature.
Whenever a spell deals damage to Tephraderm, Tephraderm deals that much damage to that spell's controller.

cards.name: Thoughtbound Primoc
cards.text:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, if a player controls more Wizards than each other player, the player who controls the most Wizards gains control of Thoughtbound Primoc.
cards.flavor: Efforts to use them as spies failed when they kept reporting to the enemy.
cards.originalText:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, if a player controls more Wizards than any other player, he or she gains control of Thoughtbound Primoc.

cards.name: Threaten
cards.text: Untap target creature and gain control of it until end of turn. That creature gains haste until end of turn. (It can attack and {T} this turn.)
cards.flavor: Goblins' motivational techniques are crude, but effective.
cards.originalText: Untap target creature and gain control of it until end of turn. That creature gains haste until end of turn.

cards.name: Thunder of Hooves
cards.text: Thunder of Hooves deals X damage to each creature without flying and each player, where X is the number of Beasts on the battlefield.
cards.originalText: Thunder of Hooves deals X damage to each creature without flying and each player, where X is the number of Beasts in play.

cards.name: Wave of Indifference
cards.text: X target creatures can't block this turn.
cards.flavor:
"Darius?"
"Yeah?"
"There's a goblin sneaking up on you."
"So?"
"Just sayin'."
cards.originalText: X target creatures can't block this turn.

cards.name: Words of War
cards.text: {1}: The next time you would draw a card this turn, Words of War deals 2 damage to any target instead.
cards.flavor:
"Passions can't be shackled by laws or mastered with logic. The choice is freedom or death."
—Volume IV, The Book of Fire

rulings.text: If multiple Words have been used prior to drawing a card, then you can choose which one to apply (and use up) each time you draw a card.

cards.originalText: {1}: The next time you would draw a card this turn, Words of War deals 2 damage to target creature or player instead.

cards.name: Animal Magnetism
cards.text: Reveal the top five cards of your library. An opponent chooses a creature card from among them. Put that card onto the battlefield and the rest into your graveyard.
cards.originalText: Reveal the top five cards of your library. An opponent chooses a creature card from among them. Put that card into play and the rest into your graveyard.

cards.name: Barkhide Mauler
cards.text: Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
cards.flavor: Anywhere else they would be hunted for their skins, but in Wirewood, they are safe.

rulings.text: Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

cards.originalText: Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card from your hand: Draw a card.)

cards.name: Biorhythm
cards.text: Each player's life total becomes the number of creatures they control.
cards.flavor:
"I have seen life's purpose, and now it is my own."
—Kamahl, druid acolyte

rulings.text: If a player controls no creatures when this resolves, their life total will become zero and they will lose the game.
This spell causes the player to lose or gain enough life to change to the new life total.

cards.originalText: Each player's life total becomes the number of creatures he or she controls.

cards.name: Birchlore Rangers
cards.text:
Tap two untapped Elves you control: Add one mana of any color.
Morph {G} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)

rulings.text: Since the ability does not have the {T} symbol, you can use the ability before this creature begins a turn under your control.
It can tap itself but is not required to do so.

cards.originalText:
Tap two untapped Elves you control: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.
Morph {G} (You may play this face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)

cards.name: Bloodline Shaman
cards.text: {T}: Choose a creature type. Reveal the top card of your library. If that card is a creature card of the chosen type, put it into your hand. Otherwise, put it into your graveyard.
cards.flavor: Every creature of the forest has a name, and she knows them all.
cards.originalText: {T}: Choose a creature type. Reveal the top card of your library. If that card is a creature card of the chosen type, put it into your hand. Otherwise, put it into your graveyard.

cards.name: Broodhatch Nantuko
cards.text:
Whenever Broodhatch Nantuko is dealt damage, you may create that many 1/1 green Insect creature tokens.
Morph {2}{G} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)

rulings.text: You can choose to put zero tokens or all the tokens onto the battlefield. You can't choose a number in between.

cards.originalText:
Whenever Broodhatch Nantuko is dealt damage, you may put that many 1/1 green Insect creature tokens into play.
Morph {2}{G} (You may play this face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)

cards.name: Centaur Glade
cards.text: {2}{G}{G}: Create a 3/3 green Centaur creature token.
cards.flavor: The Mirari called to the centaurs, and all who heard it were forever changed.
cards.originalText: {2}{G}{G}: Put a 3/3 green Centaur creature token into play.

cards.name: Chain of Acid
cards.text: Destroy target noncreature permanent. Then that permanent's controller may copy this spell and may choose a new target for that copy.
cards.originalText: Destroy target noncreature permanent. Then that permanent's controller may copy this spell and may choose a new target for that copy.

cards.name: Crown of Vigor
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1.
Sacrifice Crown of Vigor: Enchanted creature and other creatures that share a creature type with it get +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "Life, be my shield."
cards.originalText:
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1.
Sacrifice Crown of Vigor: Enchanted creature and other creatures that share a creature type with it get +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Elven Riders
cards.text: Elven Riders can't be blocked except by Walls and/or creatures with flying.
cards.flavor: "Wirewood cannot hide great size. Only with speed and skill can we survive here."

rulings.text: Creatures with the Reach ability (such as Giant Spider) don't actually have Flying, so they can't block this.

cards.originalText: Elven Riders can't be blocked except by creatures with flying and/or Walls.

cards.name: Elvish Guidance
cards.text:
Enchant land
Whenever enchanted land is tapped for mana, its controller adds an additional {G} for each Elf on the battlefield.
cards.flavor: "Old home never forgotten, new home ours forever."
cards.originalText: Whenever enchanted land is tapped for mana, its controller adds {G} to his or her mana pool for each Elf in play.

cards.name: Elvish Pathcutter
cards.text: {2}{G}: Target Elf creature gains forestwalk until end of turn. (It can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)
cards.flavor: In harsh times, the strongest currency is cooperation.
cards.originalText: {2}{G}: Target Elf gains forestwalk until end of turn.

cards.name: Elvish Pioneer
cards.text: When Elvish Pioneer enters the battlefield, you may put a basic land card from your hand onto the battlefield tapped.
cards.flavor:
"Destruction is the work of an afternoon. Creation is the work of a lifetime."
—Kamahl, druid acolyte
cards.originalText: When Elvish Pioneer comes into play, you may put a basic land card from your hand into play tapped.

cards.name: Elvish Scrapper
cards.text: {G}, {T}, Sacrifice Elvish Scrapper: Destroy target artifact.
cards.flavor: "The stories tell of a distant time when machines overran the forests, destroying everything that lived. That time will not come again."
cards.originalText: {G}, {T}, Sacrifice Elvish Scrapper: Destroy target artifact.

cards.name: Elvish Vanguard
cards.text: Whenever another Elf enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on Elvish Vanguard.
cards.flavor: "Our lives are woven together like the trees' branches over our heads, forming a canopy that protects us all."

rulings.text: If Elvish Vanguard enters the battlefield at the same time as another Elf, its ability will trigger.

cards.originalText: Whenever another Elf comes into play, put a +1/+1 counter on Elvish Vanguard.

cards.name: Elvish Warrior
cards.flavor: "My tales of war are the stories most asked for around the fires at night, but they're the ones I care least to tell."

cards.name: Enchantress's Presence
cards.text: Whenever you cast an enchantment spell, draw a card.
cards.flavor: "The wise learn from successes as well as mistakes."

rulings.text: It does not trigger for itself being cast.

cards.originalText: Whenever you play an enchantment spell, draw a card.

cards.name: Everglove Courier
cards.text:
You may choose not to untap Everglove Courier during your untap step.
{2}{G}, {T}: Target Elf creature gets +2/+2 and has trample for as long as Everglove Courier remains tapped.

rulings.text: It checks the creature type when the ability is announced and resolved, but once the effect is placed on the creature, if its creature type changes the effect still continues.

cards.originalText:
You may choose not to untap Everglove Courier during your untap step.
{2}{G}, {T}: As long as Everglove Courier remains tapped, target Elf gets +2/+2 and has trample.

cards.name: Explosive Vegetation
cards.text: Search your library for up to two basic land cards, put them onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: Torching Krosa would be pointless. It grows faster than it burns.
cards.originalText: Search your library for up to two basic land cards and put them into play tapped. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Gigapede
cards.text:
Shroud (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, if Gigapede is in your graveyard, you may discard a card. If you do, return Gigapede to your hand.
cards.originalText:
Gigapede can't be the target of spells or abilities.
At the beginning of your upkeep, if Gigapede is in your graveyard, you may discard a card from your hand. If you do, return Gigapede to your hand.

cards.name: Heedless One
cards.text:
Trample
Heedless One's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Elves on the battlefield.
cards.flavor: "Channel your vitality through me."
cards.originalText:
Trample
Heedless One's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Elves in play.

cards.name: Hystrodon
cards.text:
Trample
Whenever Hystrodon deals combat damage to a player, you may draw a card.
Morph {1}{G}{G} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
cards.originalText:
Trample
Whenever Hystrodon deals combat damage to a player, you may draw a card.
Morph {1}{G}{G} (You may play this face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)

cards.name: Invigorating Boon
cards.text: Whenever a player cycles a card, you may put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.
cards.flavor: The Mirari's echoes rang in the scouts' minds long after they had returned from the Krosan Forest.
cards.originalText: Whenever a player cycles a card, you may put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.

cards.name: Kamahl, Fist of Krosa
cards.text:
{G}: Target land becomes a 1/1 creature until end of turn. It's still a land.
{2}{G}{G}{G}: Creatures you control get +3/+3 and gain trample until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "My mind has changed. My strength has not."

rulings.text: The second ability only applies to creatures you control at the time it resolves.
The Legend rule only applies to two legendary permanents with identical names. If the names are different, even if they depict the same character, the rule does not apply.

A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

foreignNames.name: Kamahl, la Poigne de la Krosia

cards.originalText:
{G}: Target land becomes a 1/1 creature until end of turn. It's still a land.
{2}{G}{G}{G}: Creatures you control get +3/+3 and gain trample until end of turn.

cards.name: Kamahl's Summons
cards.text: Each player may reveal any number of creature cards from their hand. Then each player creates a 2/2 green Bear creature token for each card they revealed this way.
cards.flavor: As Krosa unleashed the peace in Kamahl, he unleashed the fury in Krosa.
cards.originalText: Each player may reveal any number of creature cards from his or her hand. Then each player puts a 2/2 green Bear creature token into play for each card he or she revealed this way.

cards.name: Krosan Colossus
cards.text: Morph {6}{G}{G} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
cards.flavor: When it walked, it altered geography. When it bellowed, it changed the weather.
cards.originalText: Morph {6}{G}{G} (You may play this face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)

cards.name: Krosan Groundshaker
cards.text: {G}: Target Beast creature gains trample until end of turn.
cards.flavor: You know it's coming when you hear the distant thunder. You know where it's been when you see the path of broken trees.
cards.originalText: {G}: Target Beast gains trample until end of turn.

cards.name: Krosan Tusker
cards.text:
Cycling {2}{G} ({2}{G}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
When you cycle Krosan Tusker, you may search your library for a basic land card, reveal that card, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library. (Do this before you draw.)

rulings.text: Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

When you cycle this card, first the cycling ability goes on the stack, then the triggered ability goes on the stack on top of it. The triggered ability will resolve before you draw a card from the cycling ability.

The cycling ability and the triggered ability are separate. If the triggered ability doesn't resolve (due to being countered with Stifle, for example, or if all its targets have become illegal), the cycling ability will still resolve and you'll draw a card.

cards.originalText:
Cycling {2}{G} ({2}{G}, Discard this card from your hand: Draw a card.)
When you cycle Krosan Tusker, you may search your library for a basic land card, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Leery Fogbeast
cards.text: Whenever Leery Fogbeast becomes blocked, prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.
cards.flavor: It emerges from the mists only to feed.
cards.originalText: Whenever Leery Fogbeast becomes blocked, prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.

cards.name: Mythic Proportions
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +8/+8 and has trample.
cards.flavor: The blood of Krosa turns rational beings into primal forces.
cards.originalText: Enchanted creature gets +8/+8 and has trample.

cards.name: Naturalize
cards.text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
cards.flavor: "From here, let the world be reborn."
cards.originalText: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.

cards.name: Overwhelming Instinct
cards.text: Whenever you attack with three or more creatures, draw a card.
cards.flavor: The biggest difference between a victory and a massacre is which side you're on.
cards.originalText: Whenever you attack with three or more creatures, draw a card.

cards.name: Primal Boost
cards.text:
Target creature gets +4/+4 until end of turn.
Cycling {2}{G} ({2}{G}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
When you cycle Primal Boost, you may have target creature get +1/+1 until end of turn.

rulings.text: Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

cards.originalText:
Target creature gets +4/+4 until end of turn.
Cycling {2}{G} ({2}{G}, Discard this card from your hand: Draw a card.)
When you cycle Primal Boost, you may have target creature get +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Ravenous Baloth
cards.text: Sacrifice a Beast: You gain 4 life.
cards.flavor:
"All we know about the Krosan Forest we have learned from those few who made it out alive."
—Elvish refugee
cards.originalText: Sacrifice a Beast: You gain 4 life.
